questions.answer: Each labourer gave Somadatta two sticks of wood.

questions.question: What did Somadatta do with the first bundle of sticks he collected?
questions.answer: He took the bundle to the market, sold it, and bought more gram with the money.

questions.question: Why did Somadatta become well-known among the labourers?
questions.answer: He became well-known as the nice boy who offered tasty gram and refreshing water.

questions.question: At what times of the day did Somadatta sell his goods?
questions.answer: He sold wood in the morning and gram in the evening.

questions.answer: He bought all the wood from the labourers and sold it at a good price in the market.

questions.question: How did Somadatta treat his customers?

questions.question: What does 'paid in kind' mean?
questions.answer: 'Paid in kind' means paying with things, articles, or grain instead of cash.

questions.question: What did Somadatta become after a few years?
questions.answer: Somadatta became a wealthy merchant in the town.

questions.question: Why did Somadatta go back to the rich merchant with a golden mouse?
questions.answer: He went back to return the 'capital' (the dead mouse) he had borrowed years ago.

questions.question: Who did Somadatta marry?
questions.answer: Somadatta married the rich merchant's daughter.

questions.question: What three qualities helped Somadatta earn money and respect?
questions.answer: He earned money and respect due to his intelligence, hard work, and politeness.
